00022 /**
00023  * @file   ProbesetSummarizeEngine.cpp
00024  * @author Chuck Sugnet
00025  * @date   Mon Oct 24 12:21:35 2005
00026  * 
00027  * @brief  Program for summarizing probeset results from the command line. Requires
00028  * three main inputs: 1) layout file decribing individual probes and their grouping into 
00029  * probe sets. 2) clf file telling where probes are located on chip. 3) Data input files,
00030  * usually cel files.
00031  *
00032  * @todo runImp is getting long, time to refactor.
00033  * @todo Windows documentation and example quantification method.
00034  * @todo Figure out what debugging information necessary for remote troubleshooting and include it somewhere.
00035  * @todo Enable quantile normalization withing groups and median normalization across groups.
00036  * @todo DABG flag for -logP output
00037  * @todo Only read in required columns from map files.
00038  * @todo For QC Reports: consider making the P-value threshold for detection configurable
00039  *       from the command line, with the default set from the pgf file.
00040  */
00041

00079 ProbesetSummarizeEngine * ProbesetSummarizeEngine::FromBase(BaseEngine *engine)
00080 {
00081     if (engine != NULL && engine->getEngineName() == ProbesetSummarizeEngine::EngineName())
00082         return (ProbesetSummarizeEngine *)engine;
00083     return NULL;
00084 }
00085 
00086 ProbesetSummarizeEngine::ProbesetSummarizeEngine() {
00087     m_a5_global_input_file = NULL;
00088     m_a5_global_input_group = NULL;
00089     m_a5_global_output_file = NULL;
00090     m_a5_global_output_group = NULL;
00091     defineStdMethods();
00092     defineOptions();
00093 }

00095 ProbesetSummarizeEngine::~ProbesetSummarizeEngine() {
00096 }

00098 void ProbesetSummarizeEngine::defineStdMethods() {
00099     m_stdMethods["plier-gcbg"] = "quant-norm.sketch=0.bioc=false,pm-gcbg,plier";
00100     m_stdMethods["plier-mm"] = "quant-norm.sketch=0.bioc=false,pm-mm,plier";
00101     m_stdMethods["rma"] = "rma-bg,quant-norm.sketch=0.usepm=true.bioc=true,pm-only,med-polish";
00102     m_stdMethods["plier-gcbg-sketch"] = "quant-norm.sketch=-1.bioc=false,pm-gcbg,plier";
00103     m_stdMethods["plier-mm-sketch"] = "quant-norm.sketch=-1.bioc=false,pm-mm,plier";
00104     m_stdMethods["rma-sketch"] = "rma-bg,quant-norm.sketch=-1.usepm=true.bioc=true,pm-only,med-polish";
00105     m_stdMethods["dabg"] = "pm-only,dabg";
00106 }

00355 void ProbesetSummarizeEngine::defineStates() {

00357                  "The number of rows on the chip.",

00364                  "-1");

00373 /** 
00374  * Make sure that our options are sane.
00375  * 
00376  * @param o - Options to be checked.
00377  */
00378 void ProbesetSummarizeEngine::checkOptionsImp() {
00379 
00380     defineStates();
00381 
00382     setLibFileOpt("cdf-file");
00383     setLibFileOpt("spf-file");
00384     setLibFileOpt("pgf-file");
00385     setLibFileOpt("clf-file");
00386     setLibFileOpt("bgp-file");
00387     setLibFileOpt("probeset-ids");
00388     setLibFileOpt("meta-probesets");
00389     setLibFileOpt("probe-class-file");
00390     setLibFileOpt("qc-probesets");
00391     setLibFileOpt("use-feat-eff");
00392     setLibFileOpt("target-sketch");
00393     setLibFileOpt("reference-profile");
00394     setLibFileOpt("kill-list");
00395     setLibFileOpt("a5-global-input-file");
00396     setLibFileOpt("a5-sketch-input-file");
00397     setLibFileOpt("a5-feature-effects-input-file");
00398 
00399     if (getOpt("explain") != "") { explain(); exit(0); }
00400 
00401     if (getOpt("out-dir") == "") {Err::errAbort("Must specify an output directory.");}
00402     if (getOpt("temp-dir") == "") { setOpt("temp-dir", Fs::join(getOpt("out-dir"),"temp")); }
00403 
00404     bool cdfMode = false;
00405     bool pgfMode = false;
00406 
00407     if (getOpt("cdf-file")!="" || getOpt("spf-file")!="") 
00408         cdfMode = true;
00409     if (getOpt("pgf-file")!="")
00410         pgfMode = true;
00411 
00412     if (cdfMode && pgfMode) {
00413         Err::errAbort("Must specify only one layout spec: cdf, pgf/clf, or spf file.");
00414     }
00415 
00416     string cdfFile = getOpt("cdf-file");
00417     string spfFile = getOpt("spf-file");
00418     string pgfFile = getOpt("pgf-file");
00419     string clfFile = getOpt("clf-file");
00420     string bgpFile = getOpt("bgp-file");
00421     string killListFile = getOpt("kill-list");
00422     vector<string> analysis = getOptVector("analysis");
00423 
00424     // Check that a global file was given if the user wants global a5 output
00425     if (getOpt("a5-global-file") == "") {
00426         vector<string> optionNames;
00427         getOptionNames(optionNames);
00428         for (size_t i=0; i<optionNames.size(); i++) {
00429             string name = optionNames[i];
00430             if ( name.find("use-global") != name.npos ) {
00431                 if ( getOptBool(name) ) {
00432                     Err::errAbort("--" + name + " option given, but no global file. Must specify --a5-global-file.");
00433                 }
00434             }
00435         }
00436     }
00437     // Check that a global input file was given if the user wants global a5 input
00438     if (getOpt("a5-global-input-file") == "") {
00439         vector<string> optionNames;
00440         getOptionNames(optionNames);
00441         for (size_t i=0; i<optionNames.size(); i++) {
00442             string name = optionNames[i];
00443             if ( name.find("input-global") != name.npos ) {
00444                 if ( getOptBool(name) ){
00445                     Err::errAbort("--" + name + " option given, but no global input file. Must specify --a5-global-input-file.");
00446                 }
00447             }
00448         }
00449     }
00450 
00451     // make sure global input and output files are different
00452     if (getOpt("a5-global-input-file") == getOpt("a5-global-file"))
00453         if (getOpt("a5-global-input-file") != "")
00454             Err::errAbort("Unable to use the same A5 file for global input and output.");
00455 
00456     /* Read in cel file list from other file if specified. */
00457     vector<string> celFiles;
00458     EngineUtil::getCelFiles(celFiles, this);
00459     if (celFiles.size() == 0)
00460         Err::errAbort("No cel files specified.");
00461     setOpt("cels",celFiles);
00462 
00463     vector<string> resultFiles = getOptVector("result-files");
00464     if (resultFiles.size() > 0) {
00465         if (celFiles.size() != resultFiles.size())
00466             Err::errAbort("result-files option used but is not the same size as cel file listing");
00467         bool ccOut = getOptBool("cc-chp-output");
00468         bool mdOut = getOptBool("md-chp-output");
00469         bool xdaOut = getOptBool("xda-chp-output");
00470         if ((ccOut && mdOut) || (ccOut && xdaOut) || (mdOut && xdaOut)) 
00471             Err::errAbort("cannot use multiple CHP output formats with the result-files option");
00472     }
00473 
00474     if ((cdfMode) && (cdfFile=="" && spfFile=="")) {
00475         Err::errAbort("Must specify a layout file like cdf, spf, or pgf/clf files.");
00476     }
00477     if ((!cdfMode || pgfMode) && getOptBool("xda-chp-output")) {
00478         Err::errAbort("Must use a CDF file to generate an XDA CHP file.");
00479     }
00480     if (getOpt("probeset-ids") != "" && getOptBool("xda-chp-output")) {
00481         Err::errAbort("Can't specify a subset and XDA CHP output at same time. Must analyze all probesets for XDA CHP file output.");
00482     }
00483     if (killListFile != "" && !pgfMode && cdfFile == "") {
00484         Err::errAbort("Can't use a kill list with spf file");
00485     }
00486     if (killListFile != "" && getOptBool("xda-chp-output")) {
00487         Err::errAbort("Can't specify a kill list and XDA CHP output at same time.");
00488     }
00489     if (killListFile != "" && getOptBool("cc-md-chp-output")) {
00490         Err::errAbort("Can't specify a kill list and Expression CC CHP output at same time.");
00491     }
00492     if (killListFile != "" && getOptBool("cc-chp-output")) {
00493         Err::errAbort("Can't specify a kill list and Multi Data CC CHP output at same time.");
00494     }
00495     if (bgpFile!="" && !pgfMode)
00496         Err::errAbort("Can only use BGP file with PGF/CLF file. Not CDF or SPF.");
00497 
00498     /* Some sanity checks. */
00499     if (analysis.empty())
00500         Err::errAbort("Must specify at least one analysis to preform.");
00501 
00502     if (getOpt("probeset-ids") != "" && getOpt("meta-probesets") != "")
00503         Err::errAbort("Can't specify both probeset-ids and meta-probesets options.");
00504 
00505     // Check chip types
00506     vector<string> chipTypesInLayout;
00507 
00508     /* Get the intial info about the chip and check cel files to make sure
00509        they match. */
00510     colrow_t numRows = 0, numCols = 0;
00511     int probeCount = 0;
00512     int probeSetCount=0;
00513     int channelCount = 1;
00514 
00515     if (cdfFile!="")
00516         EngineUtil::getCdfChipType(chipTypesInLayout, numRows, numCols, probeCount, probeSetCount, cdfFile);
00517     else if (spfFile!="")
00518         EngineUtil::getSpfChipType(chipTypesInLayout, numRows, numCols, probeCount, probeSetCount, spfFile);
00519     else if (pgfMode) 
00520         EngineUtil::getPgfChipType(chipTypesInLayout, numRows, numCols, probeCount, pgfFile, clfFile);
00521     else
00522         Err::errAbort("Must specify a cdf file, spf file, or PGF and CLF files.");
00523 
00524     setOpt("num-rows", ToStr(numRows));
00525     setOpt("num-cols", ToStr(numCols));
00526     setOpt("probe-count", ToStr(probeCount));
00527     setOpt("probeset-count", ToStr(probeSetCount));
00528     setOpt("channel-count", ToStr(channelCount));
00529 
00530     if (chipTypesInLayout.empty() || chipTypesInLayout[0] == "" || probeCount == 0) 
00531         Err::errAbort("Problem determining ChipType in file: " + 
00532                       ( cdfFile != "" ? cdfFile : 
00533                         ( spfFile != "" ? spfFile : pgfFile + ToStr(", ") + clfFile) 
00534                           ) );
00535 
00536     /* Did the user "force" a set of chip types via options? */
00537     vector<string> chipTypesSupplied = getOptVector("chip-type");
00538 
00539 
00540     /* Figure out what chip type to report */
00541     if (chipTypesSupplied.size() > 0) {
00542         setOpt("chip-type", chipTypesSupplied[0]);
00543     } 
00544     else if (chipTypesInLayout.size() > 0) {
00545         setOpt("chip-type", chipTypesInLayout[0]);
00546     } 
00547     else {
00548         Err::errAbort("Unable to figure out a chip type.");
00549     }
00550 
00551     /* Do Chip Type Check */
00552     if (!getOptBool("force")) {
00553         if (chipTypesSupplied.size() > 0) {
00554             EngineUtil::checkCelChipTypes(chipTypesSupplied, probeCount, celFiles, numRows, numCols);
00555             EngineUtil::checkChipTypeVectors(chipTypesSupplied, chipTypesInLayout);
00556         }
00557         else {
00558             EngineUtil::checkCelChipTypes(chipTypesInLayout, probeCount, celFiles, numRows, numCols);
00559         }
00560     }
00561 }
00562 
00563 
00564 /** 
00565  * @brief High level function to set up analysis streams and then
00566  * start the gears turning.
00567  * 
00568  * @param asFactory - Object for making analysis streams.
00569  * @param errMsg - If there was a problem, error message gets filled in here.
00570  * @return true if successful, false otherwise.
00571  */
00572 void ProbesetSummarizeEngine::runImp() {
00573 
00574     // probeset names act as a common pool for a number of different
00575     // things so we don't have to copy the relatively large (in RAM)
00576     // probe names over and over. They are known to be used for the chp
00577     // file writers and meta probesets, but may also be used for other
00578     // things as time goes on. Change or delete them prematurely at your
00579     // own risk.
00580     std::vector<const char *> probesetNames;
00581     std::vector<const char *> probesetDisplayNames;
00582     vector<bool> probeSubset;
00583     ChipLayout *layout = NULL;
00584     vector<MetaProbeset *> metaSets;
00585     vector<AnalysisStreamExpression *> analysisStreams;
00586     vector<int> probesetIds;
00587     ProbeListFactory plFactory;
00588     //vector<ProbeListPacked> probeListVec;
00589     vector<bool> psToLoad;
00590     /* Define the currently hard-coded p-value threshold for detection, used
00591        by QC reporters.  Comment in sample-probe-summarize.pl: this should be
00592        configurable from the commandline and the default set from pgf file. */
00593     unsigned int numProbes = 0;
00594     IntensityMart *iMart = NULL;
00595     CelReader reader;
00596 
00597     try { // outer try for handling the exception.
00598         try { // inner try for memory clean up.
00599             if (!Fs::isWriteableDir(getOpt("out-dir")))
00600                 if (Fs::mkdirPath(getOpt("out-dir"), false) != APT_OK)
00601                     Err::errAbort("Can't make or write to directory: " + getOpt("out-dir"));
00602             makeTempDir(getOpt("temp-dir"));
00603   
00604             // Do we have a global output file?
00605             if (getOpt("a5-global-file") != "") {
00606                 m_a5_global_output_file=affx::TsvReport::openA5File(getOpt("a5-global-file"), !getOptBool("a5-global-file-no-replace"));
00607                 // default the group name
00608                 string groupName;
00609                 if (getOpt("a5-group")!="") {
00610                     groupName=getOpt("a5-group");
00611                 } 
00612                 else if (getOpt("set-analysis-name") != "") {
00613                     groupName=getOpt("set-analysis-name");
00614                 } 
00615                 else {
00616                     ///@todo we cannot call get name on analysis stream yet -- perhaps we need a static method to get the name given an analysis spec?
00617                     groupName="/";
00618                 }
00619                 m_a5_global_output_group=
00620                     m_a5_global_output_file->openGroup(groupName,affx::FILE5_CREATE|affx::FILE5_OPEN);
00621     
00622             }
00623 
00624             // ...a global input file?
00625             if (getOpt("a5-global-input-file") != "") {
00626                 // is the input and output files the same?
00627                 if (getOpt("a5-global-input-file") == getOpt("a5-global-file")) {
00628                     ///@todo allow same file for global input and output
00629                     Err::errAbort("Unable to use the same A5 file for global input and output.");
00630                 } 
00631                 else {
00632                     m_a5_global_input_file=new affx::File5_File();
00633                     m_a5_global_input_file->open(getOpt("a5-global-input-file"),affx::FILE5_OPEN_RO);
00634                 }
00635                 // default the group name
00636                 string groupName;
00637                 if (getOpt("a5-input-group") != "") {
00638                     groupName = getOpt("a5-input-group");
00639                 } 
00640                 else if (getOpt("set-analysis-name") != "") {
00641                     groupName=getOpt("set-analysis-name");
00642                 } 
00643                 else {
00644                     ///@todo we cannot call get name on analysis stream yet -- perhaps we need a static method to get the name given an analysis spec?
00645                     groupName="/";
00646                 }
00647                 m_a5_global_input_group=
00648                     m_a5_global_input_file->openGroup(groupName,affx::FILE5_OPEN_RO);
00649             }
00650 
00651             layout = new ChipLayout();
00652             ///@todo we only need this if pm-sum is used
00653             layout->setNeedPmAlleleMatch(true);
00654 
00655             // Load up some option values into local variables to make coding easier
00656             vector<string> celFiles = getOptVector("cels");
00657             vector<string> analysisStrings = getOptVector("analysis");
00658             unsigned int numRows = Convert::toUnsignedInt(getOpt("num-rows"));
00659             unsigned int numCols = Convert::toUnsignedInt(getOpt("num-cols"));
00660 
00661             // Load up probes to ignore
00662             probeidmap_t killList; // map of probe IDs to exclude
00663             string killListFile = getOpt("kill-list");
00664             if (killListFile != "") {
00665                 ChipLayout::fillInKillList(killListFile, killList, numRows, numCols);
00666             }
00667 
00668             // If we have a subset or meta probeset list then read it.
00669             bool haveMetaProbeset = (getOpt("probeset-ids") != "" || getOpt("meta-probesets") != "");
00670             if (haveMetaProbeset) {
00671                 bool metaFile = false;
00672                 string fileName;
00673                 if (getOpt("probeset-ids") != "" && getOpt("meta-probesets") != "")
00674                     Err::errAbort("Can't specify both probeset-ids and meta-probesets options.");
00675                 if (getOpt("meta-probesets") != "") {
00676                     fileName = getOpt("meta-probesets");
00677                     metaFile = true;
00678                 }
00679                 else {
00680                     fileName = getOpt("probeset-ids");
00681                     metaFile = false;
00682                 }
00683                 MetaProbeset::readMetaProbesets(fileName, metaFile, metaSets);
00684             }
00685 
00686             // To satisfy the function signature we create an empty set of Probes.
00687             std::vector<Probe *> emptySetOfProbes;      
00688 
00689             // will fill in metaSets if empty
00690             loadChipLayout( *layout, 
00691                             metaSets, 
00692                             //layout->m_PlFactory.m_probelist_vec,
00693                             killList, 
00694                             &probesetNames,
00695                             (getOptBool("use-pgf-names") == true ? &probesetDisplayNames : NULL),
00696                             emptySetOfProbes, 
00697                             probeSubset, 
00698                             false, 
00699                             false);
00700 
00701             AnalysisStreamFactory asFactory(QuantMethodFactory::Expression);
00702             AnalysisStreamFactory::setupAnalysisStreamFactory(
00703                 asFactory,
00704                 m_a5_global_input_file,
00705                 m_a5_global_input_group,
00706                 m_a5_global_output_file,
00707                 m_a5_global_output_group,
00708                 getOptVector("cels").size(),
00709                 getOptInt("probe-count"),
00710                 getOpt("out-dir"),
00711 
00712                 getOptBool("write-sketch"),
00713                 getOpt("target-sketch"),
00714 
00715                 getOptBool("write-profile"),
00716                 getOpt("reference-profile"),
00717 
00718                 getOptBool("a5-sketch"),
00719                 getOptBool("a5-sketch-use-global"),
00720 
00721                 getOptBool("a5-sketch-input-global"),
00722                 getOpt("a5-sketch-input-file"),
00723                 getOpt("a5-sketch-input-name"),
00724                 getOpt("a5-sketch-input-group"),
00725 
00726                 getOpt("use-feat-eff"),
00727                 getOptBool("a5-feature-effects-input-global"),
00728                 getOpt("a5-feature-effects-input-file"),
00729                 getOpt("a5-feature-effects-input-name"),
00730                 getOpt("a5-feature-effects-input-group"),
00731 
00732                 getOpt("a5-input-group"),
00733                 getOpt("a5-group"),
00734 
00735                 getOpt("set-analysis-name"),
00736                 ///@todo bit of a hack -- assumes a simple string search for med-polish or plier
00737                 getOptVector("analysis")[0],
00738 
00739                 getOpt("bgp-file"),
00740                 getOpt("annotation-file"),
00741                 *layout
00742                 );
00743 
00744 
00745             int toRun = metaSets.size();
00746 
00747             mergeProbeSubset(layout->m_PlFactory.m_probelist_vec, probeSubset);
00748 
00749             vector<int> desiredOrder;
00750             determineDesiredOrder(*layout, desiredOrder, asFactory, haveMetaProbeset, metaSets);
00751 
00752             numProbes = layout->getProbeCount();  
00753 
00754             string diskDir = getOpt("temp-dir");
00755             if (getOptBool("use-disk")) {
00756                 DiskIntensityMart* diskMart = 
00757                     new DiskIntensityMart(desiredOrder, 
00758                                           celFiles, 
00759                                           getOptInt("disk-cache") * 1048576,
00760                                           diskDir, 
00761                                           "apt-summarize.tmp",
00762                                           true);
00763                 if (haveMetaProbeset || getOptBool("store-duplicate-probes")) {
00764                     diskMart->setUseAuxMemCache(true);
00765                 }
00766                 iMart = diskMart;
00767             }
00768             else {
00769                 SparseMart* sparseMart = new SparseMart(desiredOrder, celFiles, true);
00770                 iMart = sparseMart;
00771             }
00772         
00773             assert(celFiles.size() > 0);
00774 
00775             // set up cel stat listener
00776             map<string, vector<bool> > masks;
00777 
00778             vector<bool> pmMask = layout->getPmProbeMask();
00779             masks["pm"] = pmMask;
00780 
00781             vector<bool> mmMask = layout->getMmProbeMask();
00782             int mmCount = 0;
00783             for (size_t i=0; i<mmMask.size(); i++)
00784                 if (mmMask[i])
00785                     mmCount++;
00786             if (mmCount > 5000) {
00787                 masks["mm"] = mmMask;
00788             }
00789 
00790             // if there are gc control probes, save a background mask and
00791             // also add probes to probeSubset.
00792             const vector<Probe*> &probesToLoad = asFactory.getGcControlProbes(); 
00793             if (probesToLoad.size() > 0) {
00794                 vector<bool> bgMask(pmMask.size(), false);
00795                 //
00796                 int probeSubset_size=probeSubset.size();
00797                 int bgMask_size=bgMask.size();
00798                 for (unsigned int i = 0; i < probesToLoad.size(); i++) {
00799                     int p_id = probesToLoad[i]->id;
00800                     if ((p_id>=probeSubset_size)||(p_id>=bgMask_size)) {
00801                         Err::errAbort("The probeid "+ToStr(p_id)+" from the BgpFile is out of range."
00802                                       " (0-"+ToStr(probeSubset_size)+")");
00803                     }
00804                     probeSubset.at(p_id) = true;
00805                     bgMask.at(p_id) = true;
00806                 }
00807                 masks["bgrd"] = bgMask;
00808             }
00809 
00810             Verbose::out(2, "Loading: " + ToStr(probeSubset.size()) + " probes");
00811             int subsetSum = 0;
00812             for (size_t blah = 0; blah < probeSubset.size(); blah++) {
00813                 if (probeSubset[blah]) {
00814                     subsetSum++;
00815                 }
00816             }
00817 
00818             if (getOpt("probe-class-file") != "")
00819                 EngineUtil::readProbeClassFile(getOpt("probe-class-file"), layout->getProbeCount(), masks);
00820 
00821             map<string, vector<bool> >::iterator maskIter;
00822             for (maskIter = masks.begin(); maskIter != masks.end(); maskIter++) {
00823                 int count = 0;
00824                 for (vector<bool>::iterator mIx = maskIter->second.begin(); mIx != maskIter->second.end(); mIx++)
00825                     if (*mIx) 
00826                         count++;
00827                 Verbose::out(2,"Number of " + maskIter->first + " probes is: " + ToStr(count));
00828             }
00829 
00830             CelStatListener celStats(masks);
00831 
00832             /* Make the analysis pathways. */
00833             for (size_t i = 0; i < analysisStrings.size(); i++) {
00834                 AnalysisStreamExpression *as = NULL;
00835 
00836                 if (analysisStrings[i] == "")
00837                     Err::errAbort("Invalid (blank) analysis specification");
00838                 as = asFactory.constructExpressionAnalysisStream(analysisStrings[i], *layout, m_stdMethods, getOpt("set-analysis-name"));
00839                 as->setOutPrefix(getOpt("out-dir"));
00840                 QuantExprMethod *eMethod = NULL;
00841                 eMethod = dynamic_cast<QuantExprMethod *>(as->getQuantMethod());
00842       
00843                 AnalysisInfo analInfo = makeAnalysisInfo(as, *layout, metaSets);
00844                 as->setInfo(analInfo);
00845 
00846                 setupReporters(as, eMethod, metaSets, &celStats);
00847                 analysisStreams.push_back(as);
00848 
00849                 // %HACK% This is the least painful way I could think of to pass
00850                 // the bgp filename to the QuantDabg QuantExprMethod.
00851                 if (InstanceOf(eMethod, QuantDabg)) {
00852                     QuantDabg* dabgMethod = dynamic_cast<QuantDabg*>(eMethod);
00853                     dabgMethod->setBgpFileName(getOpt("bgp-file"));
00854                 }
00855             }
00856 
00857 
00858             /* Set up the cel reader */
00859             reader.setFiles(celFiles);
00860             for (unsigned int analysisIx = 0; analysisIx < analysisStreams.size(); analysisIx++)
00861                 analysisStreams[analysisIx]->registerChipStreamObjs(reader);
00862             reader.registerCelListener(&celStats);
00863             reader.registerIntensityMart(iMart);
00864 
00865             /* Read CEL files */
00866             reader.readFiles();
00867 
00868             writeHeaders(*iMart, analysisStreams);
00869             /* Write headers after iMart is populated as reports key off cels loaded into iMart */
00870             for (unsigned int analysisIx = 0; analysisIx < analysisStreams.size(); analysisIx++)
00871                 analysisStreams[analysisIx]->prepare(*iMart);
00872 
00873 
00874             /* Do the analysis */
00875             doSummaries(*layout, *iMart, layout->m_PlFactory.m_probelist_vec, metaSets, analysisStreams, toRun);
00876 
00877             /* Let the streams do their post summaries cleanup. */
00878             Verbose::out(1,"Flushing output reporters. Finalizing output.");
00879             for (unsigned int analysisIx = 0; analysisIx < analysisStreams.size(); analysisIx++)
00880                 analysisStreams[analysisIx]->finish();
00881             closeGlobalA5();
00882 
00883             Verbose::out(1,"Done.");
00884         } // inner try end
00885         catch(...) {
00886             for (uint32_t setIx = 0; setIx < metaSets.size(); setIx++) {
00887                 delete metaSets[setIx];
00888             }
00889             metaSets.clear();
00890             for (uint32_t psIx = 0; psIx < probesetNames.size(); psIx++) {
00891                 FreezArray(probesetNames[psIx]);
00892             }
00893             for (uint32_t psIx = 0; psIx < probesetDisplayNames.size(); psIx++) {
00894                 FreezArray(probesetDisplayNames[psIx]);
00895             }
00896             for (uint32_t i = 0; i < analysisStreams.size(); i++) 
00897                 delete analysisStreams[i];
00898             analysisStreams.clear();
00899             Freez(layout);
00900             Freez(iMart);
00901             closeGlobalA5();
00902             removeTempDir(getOpt("temp-dir"));
00903 
00904             // re-throw the unchanged exception.
00905             throw;
00906         }
00907     } // end outer try
00908     /* When things go wrong see if we can die gracefully here. */
00909     catch(Except &e) {
00910         Verbose::out(0,"");
00911         Err::errAbort(e.what());
00912     }
00913     catch(const std::bad_alloc &e) {
00914         Verbose::out(0,"");
00915         Err::errAbort("Ran out of memory. "
00916                       "Try using quitting other applications.");
00917     }
00918     catch(CalvinException &ce) {
00919         Verbose::out(0,"");
00920         Err::errAbort("Affymetrix GeneChip Command Console library has thrown an exception. "
00921                       "Calvin Error: '" +StringUtils::ConvertWCSToMBS(ce.Description()) + "'");
00922     }
00923     catch(const std::exception &e) {
00924         Verbose::out(0,"");
00925         Err::errAbort("Exception caught. "
00926                       "Most problems with this program are memory related. "
00927                       "Message is: " + ToStr(e.what()));
00928     }
00929     catch(const BaseException &e) {
00930         Verbose::out(0,"");
00931         Err::errAbort("newmat issue: " + ToStr(e.what()));
00932     }
00933     catch(...) {
00934         Verbose::out(0,"");
00935         Err::errAbort("Unknown exception caught "
00936                       "(most problems with this program are memory related).");
00937     }
00938     // cleanup -- KEEP IN SYNC WITH MEMORY FREEZ ABOVE IN CATCH
00939     for (uint32_t setIx = 0; setIx < metaSets.size(); setIx++) {
00940         delete metaSets[setIx];
00941     }
00942     metaSets.clear();
00943     for (uint32_t psIx = 0; psIx < probesetNames.size(); psIx++) {
00944         FreezArray(probesetNames[psIx]);
00945     }
00946     for (uint32_t psIx = 0; psIx < probesetDisplayNames.size(); psIx++) {
00947         FreezArray(probesetDisplayNames[psIx]);
00948     }
00949     for (uint32_t i = 0; i < analysisStreams.size(); i++) 
00950         delete analysisStreams[i];
00951     analysisStreams.clear();
00952     Freez(layout);
00953     Freez(iMart);
00954     removeTempDir(getOpt("temp-dir"));
00955 }
00956 
00957 /** 
00958  * @brief Write the headers for the various reports.
00959  * 
00960  * @param layout - Probe and probe set info.
00961  * @param iMart - Memory reprentation of data.
00962  * @param analysis - Collection of all the analysis that we are going to run.
00963  * @param startTime - Time of the beginning of processing.
00964  */
00965 void ProbesetSummarizeEngine::writeHeaders(IntensityMart &iMart,
00966                                            std::vector<AnalysisStreamExpression *> &analysis) {
00967   
00968     for (unsigned int analysisIx = 0; analysisIx < analysis.size(); analysisIx++) {
00969         string qMethodGuid = affxutil::Guid::GenerateNewGuid();
00970         AnalysisStreamExpression *as = analysis[analysisIx];
00971         assert(as);
00972         AnalysisInfo info = as->getInfo();
00973         as->addStdHeaders(getOpt("exec-guid"),
00974                           getOpt("time-start"),
00975                           getOpt("command-line"),
00976                           getOpt("version-to-report"),
00977                           info);
00978     }
00979 }
00980 
00981 ProbeSetGroup *ProbesetSummarizeEngine::makeProbesetGroupFromMeta(MetaProbeset &meta, ChipLayout &layout) {
00982     ProbeSetGroup *group = new ProbeSetGroup();
00983     group->ownMem = true;
00984     group->name = Util::cloneString(meta.name);
00985         group->displayName = meta.displayName;
00986     group->probeSets.resize(meta.probesets.size());
00987     int type = 0;
00988     int cnt = 0;
00989     for (int metaIx = 0; metaIx < meta.probesets.size(); metaIx++) {
00990         ProbeListPacked sub = layout.getProbeListByName(meta.probesets[metaIx]);
00991         if (sub.isNull()) {
00992             Verbose::out(2,"Skipping probeset " + ToStr(meta.probesets[metaIx]) + " in meta probeset " + ToStr(meta.name) + ". (Due to kill list?)");
00993         }
00994         else {
00995             if (cnt == 0) {
00996                 type = sub.get_type();
00997             }
00998             if (type != sub.get_type()) {
00999                 Err::errAbort("For meta probeset id: '" + ToStr(meta.name) + "'. Can't combine different types of probesets.");
01000             }
01001             ProbeSet *ps = ProbeListFactory::asProbeSet(sub);
01002             group->probeSets[cnt] = ps;
01003             cnt++;
01004         }
01005     }
01006     if (cnt > 0) {
01007         group->probeSets.resize(cnt);
01008         return group;
01009     } 
01010     else {
01011         Verbose::out(2,"Skipping meta probeset probeset " + ToStr(meta.name) + ". (Due to kill list?)");
01012         delete group;
01013         return NULL;
01014     }
01015 }
01016 
01017 /** 
01018  * @brief Loop through the groups and do the requested analysis for
01019  * each one.
01020  * 
01021  * @param layout - Probe and probe set info.
01022  * @param iMart - Memory reprentation of data.
01023  * @param psGroups - Groups of probe sets to be analyzed.
01024  * @param analysis - Analysis pathways to be computed.
01025  */
01026 void ProbesetSummarizeEngine::doSummaries(ChipLayout &layout,
01027                                           IntensityMart &iMart,
01028                                           const vector<ProbeListPacked>& plVec,
01029                                           vector<MetaProbeset *> &metaToRun,
01030                                           vector<AnalysisStreamExpression *> &analysis,
01031                                           int numPsSets) {
01032     vector<QuantMethodReport *> qReports;
01033     if (metaToRun.size() == 0) {
01034         unsigned int dotMod = max((int)plVec.size()/20, 1);
01035         Verbose::progressBegin(1, ToStr("Processing Probesets"), 20, (int)dotMod, (int)plVec.size());
01036         /* Heavy lifting. */
01037         for (unsigned int groupIx = 0; groupIx < plVec.size(); groupIx++) {
01038             /* Little UI */
01039             Verbose::progressStep(1);
01040             /* Run each summary. */
01041             ProbeSet* ps = ProbeListFactory::asProbeSet(plVec[groupIx]);
01042             ProbeSetGroup psGroup(ps); 
01043             for (unsigned int analysisIx = 0; analysisIx < analysis.size(); analysisIx++) {
01044                 analysis[analysisIx]->doAnalysis(psGroup, iMart, true);
01045             }
01046             // psGroup should delete the memory for ps...
01047         }
01048         Verbose::progressEnd(1, ToStr("Done."));
01049     }
01050     else {
01051         unsigned int dotMod = max((int)metaToRun.size()/20, 1);
01052         Verbose::progressBegin(1, ToStr("Processing Probesets"), 20, (int)dotMod, (int)metaToRun.size());
01053         /* Heavy lifting. */
01054         for (unsigned int groupIx = 0; groupIx < metaToRun.size(); groupIx++) {
01055             /* Little UI */
01056             Verbose::progressStep(1);
01057             ProbeSetGroup *psGroup = makeProbesetGroupFromMeta(*(metaToRun[groupIx]), layout);
01058             if (psGroup != NULL) {
01059                 /* Run each summary. */
01060                 for (unsigned int analysisIx = 0; analysisIx < analysis.size(); analysisIx++) {
01061                     analysis[analysisIx]->doAnalysis(*psGroup, iMart, true);
01062                 }
01063                 delete psGroup;
01064             }
01065         }
01066         Verbose::progressEnd(1, ToStr("Done."));
01067     }
01068 }
01069 
01070 
01071 /** 
01072  * Set all of the probes in the psGroups file to be loaded.
01073  * 
01074  * @param psGroups - Vector of probests containing probes to be set as true.
01075  * @param probeSubset - Bit vector in which probe ids should be set to true.
01076  */
01077 void ProbesetSummarizeEngine::mergeProbeSubset(const std::vector<ProbeListPacked> &plVec, std::vector<bool> &probeSubset) {
01078     for (unsigned int plIx = 0; plIx < plVec.size(); plIx++) {
01079         for (int pIx = 0; pIx < plVec[plIx].probe_cnt(); pIx++) {
01080             int id = plVec[plIx].get_probeId(pIx);
01081             if (id != ProbeList::null_probe) {
01082                 probeSubset[id] = true;
01083             }
01084         }
01085     }
01086 }
01087 
01088 /** 
01089  * Construct an object for output that contains the program an
01090  * algorithm information.
01091  * @param as - AnalysisStream to get information from.
01092  * @param layout - Layout to get information from.
01093  * @param metaSets - List of probeset names to output
01094  *
01095  * @return - Information for making CHP file.
01096  */
01097 AnalysisInfo ProbesetSummarizeEngine::makeAnalysisInfo(AnalysisStream *as,
01098                                                        ChipLayout &layout, 
01099                                                        vector<MetaProbeset *> &metaSets) {
01100 
01101     AnalysisInfo info;
01102     info.m_NumExpression = layout.getNumExpressionPSets();
01103     info.m_NumGenotyping = layout.getNumGenotypeingPSets();
01104     info.m_NumRows = layout.getXCount();
01105     info.m_NumCols = layout.getYCount();
01106     info.m_NumProbeSets = metaSets.size();
01107     info.m_ProbeSetType = affxcdf::ExpressionProbeSetType;
01108     fillInAnalysisInfo(info, as);
01109 
01110     // If CHP Output, then we need list of probeset names to output
01111     // Otherwise do not waste the memory
01112     if (getOptBool("cc-md-chp-output") || getOptBool("cc-chp-output") || getOptBool("xda-chp-output")) {
01113         vector<const char *> probesetNames;
01114         vector<const char *> probesetDisplayNames;
01115         probesetNames.reserve(metaSets.size());
01116         vector<MetaProbeset *>::iterator mIx;
01117         for (mIx = metaSets.begin(); mIx != metaSets.end(); ++mIx) {
01118             probesetNames.push_back((*mIx)->name);
01119             probesetDisplayNames.push_back((*mIx)->displayName);
01120         }
01121         info.m_ProbesetNames = probesetNames;
01122         info.m_ProbesetDisplayNames = probesetDisplayNames;
01123     }
01124 
01125     // Sanity check
01126     Err::check(info.m_ParamValues.size() == info.m_ParamNames.size(), 
01127    
01128                "AnalysisInfo - Names and values out of sync.");
01129     return info;
01130 }
01131 
01132 void ProbesetSummarizeEngine::addReporters_Expression(affx::TsvReport::TsvReportFmt_t report_format,
01133                             AnalysisInfo& info,
01134                             AnalysisStream *as, int precision) {
01135 
01136     QuantMethodExprReport *report = new QuantMethodExprReport(info.getNumCols());
01137     report->m_qMethod=as->getQuantMethod();
01138     report->setIsHeaderBuffer(1);
01139     report->setDirPath(getOpt("out-dir"));
01140     report->setPrecision(precision);
01141     report->m_summary_tsv_precision=precision;
01142     report->m_feffects_tsv_precision=precision-1;
01143     report->m_residuals_tsv_precision=precision;
01144     report->setFileprefix(as->getName());
01145     report->setFilename("QuantMethodExprReport-DEBUG"); // filename not used -- for debugging
01146     report->setWriteOldStyleFeatureEffectsFile(false);
01147 
01148     if (report_format == affx::TsvReport::FMT_TSV) {
01149         report->m_DoSummary=getOptBool("summaries");
01150         report->m_DoResiduals=getOptBool("feat-details");
01151         report->m_DoFeatureEffects=getOptBool("feat-effects");
01152     } 
01153     else {
01154         report->m_DoSummary=getOptBool("a5-summaries");
01155         report->m_DoResiduals=getOptBool("a5-feature-details");
01156         report->m_DoFeatureEffects=getOptBool("a5-feature-effects");
01157 
01158         if (getOptBool("a5-summaries-use-global")) {
01159             if (m_a5_global_output_group == NULL)
01160                 Err::errAbort("--a5-summaries-use-global option given, but no global file. Must specify --a5-global-file.");
01161             report->m_summary_a5_group = m_a5_global_output_group;
01162             Verbose::out(1,"Using global A5 file for allele summary output.");
01163         }
01164     
01165         if (getOptBool("a5-feature-details-use-global")) {
01166             if (m_a5_global_output_group == NULL)
01167                 Err::errAbort("--a5-feature-details-use-global option given, but no global file. Must specify --a5-global-file.");
01168             report->m_residuals_a5_group = m_a5_global_output_group;
01169             Verbose::out(1,"Using global A5 file for residuals output.");
01170         }
01171     
01172         if (getOptBool("a5-feature-effects-use-global")) {
01173             if (m_a5_global_output_group == NULL)
01174                 Err::errAbort("--a5-feature-effects-use-global option given, but no global file. Must specify --a5-global-file.");
01175             report->m_feffects_a5_group = m_a5_global_output_group;
01176             Verbose::out(1,"Using global A5 file for feature effects output.");
01177         }
01178     }
01179 
01180     report->setFormat(report_format);
01181 
01182     report->addStdHeaders(report,
01183                           getOpt("exec-guid"),
01184                           as->getGuid(),
01185                           getOpt("time-start"),
01186                           getOpt("command-line"),
01187                           getOpt("version-to-report"),
01188                           info);
01189     as->addReporter(report);
01190 }
01191 
01192 /** 
01193  * Add the requested reporters for a given AnalysisStream.
01194  * 
01195  * @param as - AnalysisStream that needs the reporters.
01196  * @param eMethod - Expression quantification method that is being used to summarize probesets in this AnalysisStream.
01197  * @param metaSets - list of probesets to output.
01198  * @param stats -
01199  */
01200 void ProbesetSummarizeEngine::setupReporters(AnalysisStreamExpression *as, 
01201                                              QuantExprMethod *eMethod, 
01202                                              vector<MetaProbeset *> &metaSets,
01203                                              CelStatListener *stats) {
01204 
01205     int precision = getOptInt("precision");
01206     if (precision > 16) {
01207         precision = 16;
01208         Verbose::out(2, "Changing precision for reports from "+ ToStr(precision) +" to 16");
01209     }
01210     string outDir = getOpt("out-dir");
01211     vector<string> celFiles = getOptVector("cels");
01212 
01213     AnalysisInfo info = as->getInfo();
01214   
01215     /* Add our primary text reporter. */
01216     if (precision < 0) {
01217         precision = 0;
01218         if (as->getQuantMethod()->getType() == "dabg") {
01219             precision = 5;
01220         }
01221     }
01222     // Add txt expression reporter
01223     if (getOptBool("summaries") || getOptBool("feat-effects") || getOptBool("feat-details")) {
01224         addReporters_Expression(affx::TsvReport::FMT_TSV,info,as,precision);
01225     }
01226     if (getOptBool("a5-summaries") || getOptBool("a5-feature-effects") || getOptBool("a5-feature-details")) {
01227         addReporters_Expression(affx::TsvReport::FMT_A5,info,as,precision);
01228     }
01229 
01230     bool isDetection = static_cast<QuantExprMethod *>(as->getQuantMethod())->getQuantType() == QuantExprMethod::Detection;
01231 
01232     QuantMethodExprChipSummary *runSummary = new QuantMethodExprChipSummary(celFiles, isDetection, 0, 0.01, getOpt("qc-probesets"), metaSets);
01233     runSummary->setFilename("runSummary");
01234   
01235     QuantMethodRunReport *runReport = new QuantMethodRunReport(celFiles);
01236     if (getOpt("report-file") != "") {
01237         string dir = Fs::dirname(getOpt("report-file"));
01238         if (dir == "")
01239             dir = outDir;
01240         string name = Fs::basename(getOpt("report-file"));
01241         runReport->setDirPath(dir);
01242         runSummary->setDirPath(dir);
01243         runReport->setFilename(name);
01244     } 
01245     else {
01246         runSummary->setDirPath(outDir);
01247         runReport->setDirPath(outDir);
01248         runReport->setFilename(as->getName()+".report");
01249     }
01250     runReport->setFormat(affx::TsvReport::FMT_TSV);
01251     runReport->setPrecision(6);
01252 
01253     runReport->registerChipSummary(dynamic_cast<ChipSummary *>(stats));
01254     runReport->registerChipSummary(dynamic_cast<ChipSummary *>(runSummary));
01255 
01256     set<string> group;
01257     set<uint32_t> groupId;
01258     as->addReporter(runSummary);
01259     as->addReporter(runReport);
01260 
01261     // Setup Multi Data CHP Output
01262     if (getOptBool("cc-md-chp-output")){
01263         string ccchpDir;
01264         /* If chp directory not specified use  output/cc-chp/ by default. */
01265         if (getOpt("cc-md-chp-out-dir") == "") { ccchpDir = Fs::join(outDir,"cc-md-chp"); }
01266         else { ccchpDir = getOpt("cc-md-chp-out-dir"); }
01267         Util::chompLastIfSep(ccchpDir);
01268         QuantMethodMultiDataCCCHPReport *ccchpReporter = new QuantMethodMultiDataCCCHPReport(ccchpDir);
01269         vector<string> resultFiles = getOptVector("result-files");
01270         if (resultFiles.size() > 0)
01271             ccchpReporter->setChpFileNames(resultFiles);
01272         ccchpReporter->SetGenoTypeOnly(false);
01273         ccchpReporter->registerChipSummary(dynamic_cast<ChipSummary *>(stats));
01274         ccchpReporter->registerChipSummary(dynamic_cast<ChipSummary *>(runSummary));
01275         as->addReporter(ccchpReporter);
01276     }
01277 
01278     // Setup Old Expression CHP Output
01279     if (getOptBool("cc-chp-output")) {
01280         string ccchpDir;
01281         /* If chp directory not specified use  output/cc-chp/ by default. */
01282         if (getOpt("cc-chp-out-dir") == "") { ccchpDir = Fs::join(outDir,"cc-chp"); }
01283         else { ccchpDir = getOpt("cc-chp-out-dir"); }
01284         Util::chompLastIfSep(ccchpDir);
01285         QuantMethodExprCCCHPReport *ccchpReporter = new QuantMethodExprCCCHPReport(info, ccchpDir, eMethod->getType());
01286         vector<string> resultFiles = getOptVector("result-files");
01287         if (resultFiles.size() > 0)
01288             ccchpReporter->setChpFileNames(resultFiles);
01289         ccchpReporter->registerChipSummary(dynamic_cast<ChipSummary *>(stats));
01290         ccchpReporter->registerChipSummary(dynamic_cast<ChipSummary *>(runSummary));
01291         as->addReporter(ccchpReporter);
01292     }
01293 
01294     // setup XDA CHP output if neccesary.
01295     if (getOptBool("xda-chp-output")) {
01296         string chpDir;
01297         /* If chp directory not specified use  output/chp/ by default. */
01298         if (getOpt("xda-chp-out-dir") == "") { chpDir =  Fs::join(outDir,"chp"); } 
01299         else { chpDir = getOpt("xda-chp-out-dir"); }
01300         Util::chompLastIfSep(chpDir);
01301         QuantMethodExprCHPReport *chpReporter = new QuantMethodExprCHPReport(info, chpDir, eMethod->getType());
01302         vector<string> resultFiles = getOptVector("result-files");
01303         if (resultFiles.size() > 0)
01304             chpReporter->setChpFileNames(resultFiles);
01305         as->addReporter(chpReporter);
01306     }
01307   
01308     if (getOptBool("subsample-report")) {
01309         QuantMethodSamplerReport *sReport = NULL;
01310         /* Add our sampling reporter, just reports on 1 out of every 10 probesets. */
01311         string prefix = Fs::join(outDir,as->getName());
01312         sReport = new QuantMethodSamplerReport(9, prefix, 5, true, true, true);
01313         as->addReporter(sReport);
01314     }
01315 
01316 }
01317 
01318 /** 
01319  * Read the design of the chip from the cdf file. Also can read the
01320  * design from an spf file is that is supplied.
01321  * 
01322  * @param layout - Object to be filled in.
01323  * @param psGroups - Probe sets to be filled in.
01324  * @param probesToLoad - Additional probes to be loaded (i.e. background probes.)
01325  * @param probeSubset - Bitmap to remember the probes that were actually loaded.
01326  */
01327 void ProbesetSummarizeEngine::loadCdfLayout(ChipLayout &layout, 
01328                                             vector<MetaProbeset *> &metaToLoad,
01329                                             const vector<Probe *> &probesToLoad, 
01330                                             std::vector<const char *> *probesetNames,
01331                                             vector<bool> &probeSubset, 
01332                                             bool justStats, 
01333                                             bool doAll,
01334                                             probeidmap_t &killList)
01335 {
01336     set<const char *, Util::ltstr> psNameLoadMap;
01337     string cdfFile = getOpt("cdf-file");
01338     string spfFile = getOpt("spf-file");
01339 
01340     // Are we doing a subset of all the probe sets? 
01341     if (!metaToLoad.empty() && !doAll) {
01342         for (unsigned int i = 0; i < metaToLoad.size(); i++) {
01343             for (unsigned int psIx = 0; psIx < metaToLoad[i]->probesets.size(); psIx++) { 
01344                 psNameLoadMap.insert(metaToLoad[i]->probesets[psIx]);
01345             }
01346         }
01347     }
01348     // Load up the data from the file.
01349     string fileName = cdfFile!="" ? cdfFile : spfFile;
01350     try {
01351         if (cdfFile!="") {
01352             Verbose::out(1, ToStr("Opening cdf file: ") + Fs::basename(cdfFile));
01353             if (!layout.openCdf(cdfFile, 
01354                                 psNameLoadMap, 
01355                                 probesetNames,
01356                                 probeSubset, 
01357                                 "", 
01358                                 killList, 
01359                                 justStats)) 
01360                 Err::errAbort("Couldn't open cdf file: " + cdfFile);
01361         }
01362         else if (spfFile!="") {
01363             std::set<affxcdf::GeneChipProbeSetType> psTypesToLoad;
01364             if (getOpt("kill-list") != "")
01365                 Err::errAbort("Cannot specify probe kill list with spf file");
01366             Verbose::out(1, ToStr("Opening layout file: ") + Fs::basename(spfFile));
01367             layout.openSpf(spfFile, 
01368                            psNameLoadMap, 
01369                            probesetNames, 
01370                            probeSubset,
01371                            "", 
01372                            justStats, 
01373                            psTypesToLoad);
01374         }
01375         else {
01376             Err::errAbort("Must have either a cdf file or spf file in cdf mode.");
01377         }
01378     }
01379     catch(const Except &e) {
01380         Err::errAbort(e.what());
01381     }
01382     catch(...) {
01383         Err::errAbort("Uncaught exception opening file: '" + fileName + "'");
01384     }
01385 }
01386 
01387 /** 
01388  * Read the design of the chip from the pgf & clf files.
01389  * 
01390  * @param layout - Object to be filled in.
01391  * @param metaToLoad
01392  * @param probesToLoad - Additional probes to be loaded (i.e. background probes.)
01393  * @param probeSubset - Bitmap to remember the probes that were actually loaded.
01394  * @param killList  
01395  */
01396 void ProbesetSummarizeEngine::loadPgfLayout(ChipLayout &layout, 
01397                                             std::vector<MetaProbeset *> &metaToLoad,
01398                                             const std::vector<Probe *> &probesToLoad, 
01399                                             std::vector<const char *> *probesetNames,
01400                                             std::vector<const char *> *probesetDisplayNames,
01401                                             std::vector<bool> &probeSubset, 
01402                                             probeidmap_t &killList,
01403                                             bool justStats, bool doAll) {
01404     affx::ClfFile clf;
01405     vector<string> requiredCols;
01406     unsigned int i = 0;
01407     unsigned int numProbes = 0;
01408     std::set<const char *, Util::ltstr> psIdLoadMap;
01409     vector<unsigned int> psIdNotInGroup;
01410     std::string pgfFile = getOpt("pgf-file"); 
01411     std::string clfFile = getOpt("clf-file");
01412 
01413     /* open clf file. */
01414     if (clfFile=="")
01415         Err::errAbort("Must specify a clf-file for chip.");
01416     Verbose::out(1, ToStr("Opening clf file: ") +  Fs::basename(clfFile));
01417     if (!clf.open(clfFile))
01418         Err::errAbort(ToStr("Couldn't open clf file: ") + clfFile);
01419     layout.setDimensions(clf.getXMax() + 1, clf.getYMax() + 1);
01420 
01421     /* Make sure our assumptions about CLF file are true */
01422     Err::check(clf.getSequential() == 1,
01423                "ProbesetSummarizeEngine::loadPgfLayout() - unable to handle clf file without sequential set to 1.");
01424     Err::check(clf.getOrder().compare("col_major") == 0 || clf.getOrder().compare("row_major") == 0,
01425                "Unable to handle clf file without order set to row_major (old mislabeled 'col_major' accepted due to earlier bug.)");
01426 
01427     /* What probes are we loading? */
01428     numProbes = (clf.getXMax() + 1) * (clf.getYMax() + 1);
01429     probeSubset.resize(numProbes);
01430     for (i = 0; i < probeSubset.size(); i++) 
01431         probeSubset[i] = false;
01432 
01433     // Are we doing a subset of all the probe sets? 
01434     if (!metaToLoad.empty() && !doAll) {
01435         for (i = 0; i < metaToLoad.size(); i++) {
01436             for (unsigned int psIx = 0; psIx < metaToLoad[i]->probesets.size(); psIx++) { 
01437                 psIdLoadMap.insert(metaToLoad[i]->probesets[psIx]);
01438             }
01439         }
01440     }
01441   
01442     /* Open actual pgf file. */
01443     if (Util::sameString(pgfFile,"")) 
01444         Err::errAbort("Must specify PGF for chip.");
01445     Verbose::out(1, ToStr("Opening pgf file: ") + Fs::basename(pgfFile));
01446     time_t startTime = time(NULL);
01447     if (!layout.openPgf(pgfFile, clf.getXMax() + 1, clf.getYMax() + 1, psIdLoadMap, probesetNames, probesetDisplayNames,
01448                         probeSubset, "", killList, justStats, false)) {
01449         Err::errAbort("Couldn't open PGF file: " + ToStr(pgfFile));
01450     }
01451     time_t endTime = time(NULL);
01452     int t = endTime - startTime;
01453     Verbose::out(2, ToStr("Pgf load took approximately: ") + ToStr(t) + ToStr(" seconds."));
01454 }
01455 
01456 
01457 /** 
01458  * Load up the probe set definitions.
01459  * 
01460  * @param layout - Object to be filled in.
01461  * @param psGroups - Probe sets to be filled in.
01462  * @param metaToLoad
01463  * @param killList  
01464  * @param probesToLoad - Additional probes to be loaded (i.e. background probes.)
01465  * @param probeSubset - Bitmap to remember the probes that were actually loaded.
01466  * @param probetIds 
01467  * @param probesetNames
01468  */
01469 void ProbesetSummarizeEngine::loadChipLayout(ChipLayout &layout, 
01470                                              vector<MetaProbeset *> &metaToLoad,  
01471                                              probeidmap_t &killList,
01472                                              std::vector<const char *> *probesetNames,
01473                                              std::vector<const char *> *probesetDisplayNames,
01474                                              const vector<Probe *> &probesToLoad, 
01475                                              vector<bool> &probeSubset, 
01476                                              bool justStats, 
01477                                              bool doAll)
01478 {
01479     if (getOpt("cdf-file")!="" || getOpt("spf-file")!="") 
01480         loadCdfLayout(layout,
01481                       metaToLoad, 
01482                       probesToLoad, 
01483                       probesetNames, 
01484                       probeSubset, 
01485                       justStats, 
01486                       doAll, 
01487                       killList);
01488     else if (getOpt("pgf-file")!="")
01489         loadPgfLayout(layout, 
01490                       metaToLoad, 
01491                       probesToLoad, 
01492                       probesetNames,
01493                       probesetDisplayNames,
01494                       probeSubset, 
01495                       killList, 
01496                       justStats, 
01497                       doAll);
01498     else
01499         Err::errAbort("Must be in either pgf or cdf mode.");
01500     if (metaToLoad.empty()) {
01501         metaToLoad.reserve(probesetNames->size());
01502         for (unsigned int psIx = 0; psIx < probesetNames->size(); psIx++) {
01503             MetaProbeset *set = new MetaProbeset();
01504             set->freeSubs = false;
01505             set->name = (*probesetNames)[psIx];
01506             set->displayName = (probesetDisplayNames != NULL ? (*probesetDisplayNames)[psIx] : NULL);
01507             set->probesets.resize(1);
01508             set->probesets[0] = set->name;
01509             metaToLoad.push_back(set);
01510         }
01511     }
01512   else if (probesetDisplayNames != NULL)
01513   {
01514           map<string, MetaProbeset*> mpsmap;
01515           for(unsigned int mIx = 0; mIx < metaToLoad.size(); mIx++) {
01516                   mpsmap[metaToLoad[mIx]->name] = metaToLoad[mIx];
01517           }
01518           for(unsigned int psIx = 0; psIx < probesetNames->size(); psIx++) {
01519                   const char *name = (*probesetNames)[psIx];
01520                   if (mpsmap.find(name) != mpsmap.end()) {
01521                           mpsmap[name]->displayName = (*probesetDisplayNames)[psIx];
01522                   }
01523           }
01524   }
01525 //  unsigned int psCount = layout.getProbeSetCount();
01526 //  plVec.resize(psCount);
01527 //  for (unsigned int psIx = 0; psIx < psCount; psIx++) {
01528 //    plVec[psIx] = layout.getProbeListAtIndex(psIx);
01529 //  }
01530 }
01531 
01532 void
01533 ProbesetSummarizeEngine::determineDesiredOrder(ChipLayout& layout,
01534                                                vector<int> &desiredOrder, 
01535                                                AnalysisStreamFactory &asFactory,
01536                                                bool haveSubset,
01537                                                vector<MetaProbeset *> &metaSets) {
01538     const vector<Probe *> &gcProbes = asFactory.getGcControlProbes();
01539     // If no meta probesets then just use the layout in the cdf/spf/pgf
01540 
01541     if (!haveSubset) {
01542         const vector<int> &layoutOrder = layout.getProbeLayoutOrder();
01543         desiredOrder.reserve(gcProbes.size() + layoutOrder.size());
01544         for (int i = 0; i < layoutOrder.size(); i++) {
01545             desiredOrder.push_back(layoutOrder[i]);
01546         }
01547     }
01548     // If meta sets then we want to order in the same order as the
01549     // meta probesets.
01550     else {
01551         for (int i = 0; i < metaSets.size(); i++) {
01552             for (int j = 0; j < metaSets[i]->probesets.size(); j++) {
01553                 ProbeListPacked pl = layout.getProbeListByName(metaSets[i]->probesets[j]);
01554                 if (!pl.isNull()) {
01555                     for (int pIx = 0; pIx < pl.probe_cnt(); pIx++) {
01556                         desiredOrder.push_back(pl.get_probeId(pIx));
01557                     }
01558                 }
01559             }
01560         }
01561     }
01562     for (int i = 0; i < gcProbes.size(); i++) {
01563       desiredOrder.push_back(gcProbes[i]->id);
01564     }
01565 }
01566 
01567 void ProbesetSummarizeEngine::addProbeSet(ProbeSet *basicPs, ProbeSet *currentPs) {
01568     if (basicPs->atomsPerGroup.size() != 1) {
01569         Err::errAbort("addProbeset() - Error: Can't merge probesets with more than one block");
01570     }
01571     for (int i = 0; i < currentPs->atoms.size(); i++) {
01572         basicPs->atoms.push_back(currentPs->atoms[i]);
01573         ///@todo we should really make sure that PM-only and PM-MM probesets are merged correctly
01574             if (basicPs->hasMM() != currentPs->hasMM())
01575                 Err::errAbort("Cannot merge probesets which have MM with those that do not.");
01576             basicPs->atomsPerGroup[0] += (currentPs->hasMM() ? 
01577                                           currentPs->atoms[i]->probes.size() / 2 : currentPs->atoms[i]->probes.size());
01578     }
01579 
01580 }
01581

01640     for (uint32_t i = 0; i < celFiles.size(); i++) {
01641       std::string paramName = prefix + subprefix + "cel-" + ToStr(i+1);

01686 
01687 void ProbesetSummarizeEngine::printStandardMethods(std::ostream &out) {
01688     map<string,string>::iterator iter;
01689     out << endl << "Standard Methods:" << endl;
01690     unsigned int maxLength = 0;
01691     for (iter = m_stdMethods.begin(); iter != m_stdMethods.end(); iter++) {
01692         if (iter->first.size() > maxLength)
01693             maxLength = iter->first.size();
01694     }
01695     for (iter = m_stdMethods.begin(); iter != m_stdMethods.end(); iter++) {
01696         unsigned int currentLength = 0;
01697         out << " '" << iter->first << "' ";
01698         currentLength = iter->first.size();
01699         while (currentLength < maxLength + 1) {
01700             out.put(' ');
01701             currentLength++;
01702         }
01703         out << iter->second << endl;
01704     }
01705 }
01706 
01707 void ProbesetSummarizeEngine::closeGlobalA5() {
01708     // A5 close global groups
01709     if (m_a5_global_output_group!=NULL) {
01710         m_a5_global_output_group->close();
01711         delete m_a5_global_output_group;
01712         m_a5_global_output_group=NULL;
01713     }
01714     if (m_a5_global_input_group!=NULL) {
01715         m_a5_global_input_group->close();
01716         delete m_a5_global_input_group;
01717         m_a5_global_input_group=NULL;
01718     }
01719 
01720     // A5 close global files
01721     if (m_a5_global_output_file != m_a5_global_input_file) {
01722         affx::TsvReport::closeA5File(m_a5_global_output_file);
01723         affx::TsvReport::closeA5File(m_a5_global_input_file);
01724     } 
01725     else {
01726         affx::TsvReport::closeA5File(m_a5_global_output_file);
01727         m_a5_global_input_file = NULL;
01728     }
01729 }

01731 void ProbesetSummarizeEngine::extraHelp() {
01732     ChipStreamFactory cFactory;
01733     PmAdjusterFactory aFactory;
01734     QuantMethodFactory qFactory(QuantMethodFactory::Expression);
01735     AnalysisStreamFactory asFactory;
01736 
01737     printStandardMethods(cout);
01738     EngineUtil::printSelfDocs("Data transformations:", cFactory.getDocs());
01739     EngineUtil::printSelfDocs("Pm Intensity Adjustments:", aFactory.getDocs());
01740     EngineUtil::printSelfDocs("Quantification Methods:", qFactory.getDocs());
01741     EngineUtil::printSelfDocs("Analysis Streams:", asFactory.getDocs());
01742 }
